author: parithosh
content:
The inactivity leak is exponentially higher when a larger portion of the stake is offline, so if 90% is offline - more leakage and the 10% become the majority faster than if 10% were offline. So the system corrects itself to finalize faster. 

But yes, until the inactivity leak takes place - it'll be temporarily non-finalizing. 

We've tested network splits, and soon after the split was resolved we saw the chain converge and finalize as expected. For each portion of the chain, the other half was deemed inactive.

author: jgm
content:
Nope.  Leak is applied per validator.

Separately, however, the aim of the inactivity leak is to bring the sum of the attesting balance to be 2/3 of the sum of the active balance.  So if you have more validators inactive that value will be reached faster.  Haven't done the maths though to see if it makes much of a difference in any real situation.
